comments.author: Farooq Malik
comments.content:
Sounds like a very interesting trip. I hope to do something like this this upcoming winter. Would you suggest using a GPS system incase you get lost or are most people able to help you with directions?

Farooq

comments.author: KO
comments.content:
There aren’t any good Pakistani maps of GPS which I am aware of, so a GPS isn’t really that usefull for navigation. Secondly, people are very helpfull with directions.

Still, a GPS is handy to have to know things like altitude etc. as no where in the northen areas will anyone be able to tell you the precise height of whereever you are. The sign posts are often wrong too.

The other interesting use is, with a advanced model, you can save all your waypoints, and later on lay it over a map. So I would recommend using a GPS, its just that you can’t rely on it as a primary navigation.
